subject: Real Estate
title: Warranty Deed vs. Quitclaim Deed
description: A short lesson to help you apply Warranty Deed vs. Quitclaim Deed.

hook.text: A warranty deed guarantees the seller owns the property free and clear. A quitclaim guarantees nothing.

buildup.text: Warranty deeds come with legal promises â€” the seller will defend the buyer against any title claims.

discovery.text: Quitclaim deeds simply transfer whatever interest the seller has â€” which could be everything or nothing.

twist.text: Quitclaim deeds are often used in divorces and family transfers where trust already exists between parties.

climax.text: Accepting a quitclaim from a stranger is risky. They might be transferring a claim they don't actually have.

punchline.text: One deed promises ownership. The other promises nothing.
